page.title: 04TRANSPORT
page.content: ONE OF THE PROBLEMS ABOUT LIVING IN THE COUNTRY IS THE LACK OF TRANSPORT. PEOPLE HAVE TO USE THEIR OWN CARS, AS THERE IS VERY LITTLE PUBLIC TRANSPORT. IN THE VILLAGE OUT OF 76 PEOPLE QUESTIONED, 53 HAD CARS AND 23 HAD NOT. PEOPLE WHO HAD NO TRANSPORT WERE OFTEN GIVEN LIFTS TO RIPON MARKET OR TO HOSPITAL, IF THEY HAD TO VISIT FRIENDS AND RELATIONS. THE ONLY PUBLIC TRANSPORT IS A POST-BUS, WHICH CARRIES 11 PASSENGERS, AND TRAVELS UP AND DOWN THE VALLEY FROM MASHAM TO RIPON, TWICE A DAY AS IT COLLECTS THE MAIL. THIS IT DOES EVERY DAY EXCEPT THURSDAYS, SATURDAYS AND SUNDAYS. ON THURSDAY AT 10.40A.M. AND SATURDAY AT 9.10A.M. THE UNITED BUS COMPANY RUN A SERVICE BUS INSTEAD. IT IS MOSTLY OLDER PEOPLE WHO USE THE PUBLIC TRANSPORT ON THURSDAYS. Y
